## -save_binary argument
example cli:
```
./cli/hpe -train train.graph -save_binary 1 -save hpe.model -sample_times 1
```
example printing info.
```
Connections Preview:
        # of connection:        6955127
Connections Loading:
        Progress:               100.00 %
        # of vertex:            1220589
Build the Alias Method:
        Reconstructing Graph ...
        Building Alias Tables ...
        Finished.
Model Setting:
        dimension:              64
Model:
        [HPE]
Learning Parameters:
        sample_times:           1
        negative_samples:       5
        walk_steps:             5
        regularization:         0.01
        alpha:                  0.025
        workers:                1
Start Training:
        Alpha: 0.000250 Progress: 100.00 %%
Save Model:
        Save keys to <hpe.model.key>
        Save vectors to <hpe.model.vec>
```

# to read the binary data in python
```
>>> import msgpack
>>> keys = msgpack.Unpacker(open("hpe.model.key", "rb"))
>>> vecs = msgpack.Unpacker(open("hpe.model.vec", "rb"))
>>> 
>>> print(next(keys), next(vecs))
b'N88753' [0.0052256300519047715, -0.0015768217850654171, 0.004521966181937555, 0.00466164715728648, 0.006298202431823262, -0.00468214300387815, -0.0025973930675241438, 0.004087543247953962, -0.0034092445987745097, 0.000840527944837643, -0.00034684110140356704, 0.0020533347081892186, -0.002266618050586355, 0.0001723628851298172, 0.0070352754642582106, 0.006353941578566233, 0.00218879950371244, 0.003448379028983156, -0.005524777106727321, 0.0017220781809576336, -0.007528480684280348, -0.004014019415061913, -0.005747692265018587, 0.004704903370115214, -0.005372146511833673, -0.0014230057304953241, -0.005768385711563485, -0.005936980511413679, 0.007848884931200832, -0.004552483164559285, 0.0002998527689260556, 0.005303660386463669, 0.0017604506370424594, -0.0030381386858657003, 0.002223663138647485, 0.00040352608352945985, -0.00011153143561306155, 0.007334726340858612, -0.0031301920696356934, 0.004243944101491818, 0.00039599997874224455, 0.004248546266039631, -0.0015465108178605344, 0.006285879415994773, -0.0033905879895653867, -0.002196892100182934, 0.004767928323127875, 0.006520318900757826, -0.006747431550693995, 0.007161437070650594, 0.00041886413829418304, -0.006558477244502102, -0.004995040602836102, 0.0024217005529202323, 0.0060406446991160155, -0.0022234883522228134, -0.0066978006683079735, -0.007315644586892967, -0.0006807253080094762, -0.006812573277915769, -0.0041461148756767345, 0.007235926754928489, 0.006199215711233759, 0.00560809705610529]
>>> 
>>> for k, v in zip(keys, vecs):
...     print(k, v)
...     break
...
b'shop' [-0.0037793585311896864, 0.0007746935002415673, -0.002802107661278799, 0.004538630765596483, -0.0005089968113396287, 0.002449165667141009, -7.240674900921271e-05, -0.0064221934113462085, -0.001535165964543091, 0.006264248687894548, 0.007608387220977777, 0.003314098745412738, -0.003938622857117373, 0.004327715240230825, 0.0035356764729323957, -0.00229473612931818, 0.00269470474864674, -0.0046501419339556455, -0.000867295759172566, 0.004958590441083527, 0.005113462356276618, -0.002475420537606344, -0.004527819549387214, 0.00499116394554062, -0.002109748356477154, 0.002901021160404536, 0.006187701082692618, 0.0007097943573571743, 0.00180618721728266, 0.004193656802610821, -0.0010081988624890948, 0.006631690157139179, -4.091642873290798e-05, 0.004548657484830476, 0.0024618144765752286, 0.005642073688516801, -0.0003919064577003038, -0.004986516060635352, 0.007668419120458216, 0.005908753035256887, -0.005164644629816597, 0.0045038957850432725, 0.0017213616066505911, -0.001718956729309901, 0.001453056680548853, -0.00451273359206399, 0.004567504894821564, -0.0032317607970544695, -0.000321478504015417, -0.003719535108163587, -0.0038194945650216485, -0.0030113823921299574, 0.000908934320537596, -0.0007245087208720707, -0.005356952917398224, 0.005527415719004027, -0.0055062034486661575, -0.005166528090804679, 0.0008774781587691237, 0.0045749919573516325, 0.007283228616351831, 0.00648019986454114, 0.0030327783886648797, -0.0026928579488783885]
```

# msgpack installation
for c++
```
apt-get install libmsgpack-dev
```
for python
```
pip install msgpack
```
